title: Cisco Networking + APIC/ACI
description: General-to-advanced Cisco networking (IOS/IOS-XE/NX-OS) plus Cisco ACI and APIC operations: configuration patterns, verification commands, troubleshooting, and APIC APIs.

categories.title: CLI Fundamentals (IOS / IOS-XE / NX-OS)
categories.description: Modes, navigation, output filtering, and configuration management.

items.title: Modes and navigation
items.example:
terminal length 0
show version
show running-config | include ^hostname

items.title: Filtering output
items.description: Pipe/filter support varies by platform/release.
items.example:
show ip interface brief
show run | section interface

items.title: Save, checkpoints, rollback
items.description: Availability varies; verify what your platform supports.
items.example: copy running-config startup-config

categories.title: Baseline Health and Inventory
categories.description: Quick checks for platform state, resources, time, and logs.

items.title: Identity and inventory
items.example:
terminal length 0
show version
show inventory

items.title: CPU/memory
items.description: Useful for control-plane drops and intermittent outages.

rows: show processes cpu sorted / show processes memory

items.example:
show processes cpu sorted
show processes memory

items.title: Time and logging
items.example:
show clock
show ntp status
show logging | include NTP|SYS

categories.title: Interfaces (L1/L2/L3)
categories.description: Bring up interfaces, configure access/trunk, set IPs, and verify.

items.title: Verify interfaces
items.example:
show ip interface brief
show interfaces GigabitEthernet1/0/1
show interfaces GigabitEthernet1/0/1 switchport

items.title: Common interface config
items.description: Minimal pattern: description, admin up, optional MTU.
items.example:
configure terminal
interface GigabitEthernet1/0/1
description Uplink to Core
no shutdown
end

categories.title: Switching: VLANs and Trunks
categories.description: Access ports, trunk ports, native VLAN, allowed VLANs.

items.title: Access port
items.description: Assign a port to a single VLAN.
items.example:
configure terminal
interface GigabitEthernet1/0/10
switchport mode access
switchport access vlan 10
spanning-tree portfast
spanning-tree bpduguard enable
end

items.title: Trunk port
items.description: Carry multiple VLANs. Ensure native VLAN and allowed VLAN list are correct.
items.example:
configure terminal
interface GigabitEthernet1/0/1
switchport mode trunk
switchport trunk native vlan 999
switchport trunk allowed vlan 10,20,30,999
end
show interfaces trunk

items.title: VLAN and MAC verification
items.example:
show vlan brief
show mac address-table | include Gi1/0/10

categories.title: Spanning Tree
categories.description: STP/RSTP/MST verification and common protections.

items.title: STP verification
items.example:
show spanning-tree summary
show spanning-tree vlan 10

items.title: Edge-port protections
items.description: Use on host-facing ports only.
items.example:
configure terminal
interface GigabitEthernet1/0/10
spanning-tree portfast
spanning-tree bpduguard enable
end

categories.title: EtherChannel / Port-Channel
categories.description: Bundle links with LACP (preferred) and validate.

items.title: LACP configuration (conceptual)
items.description: Exact syntax varies (IOS vs NX-OS). Ensure both sides match: trunk/access, VLANs, speed/duplex.

rows:
interface range Gi1/0/1-2
channel-group 1 mode active

items.example:
show etherchannel summary
show interfaces port-channel 1

items.title: Verification
items.example:
show etherchannel summary
show lacp neighbor

categories.title: Routing Essentials
categories.description: Static routes, route lookup, and VRF basics.

items.title: Static routes
items.example:
configure terminal
ip route 0.0.0.0 0.0.0.0 192.0.2.1
end
show ip route | include 0.0.0.0

items.title: VRF quick concepts
items.description: VRF creates separate routing tables. Commands vary by platform (IOS-XE vs NX-OS).
items.example: show ip route vrf Mgmt-vrf

categories.title: OSPF (Common)
categories.description: Basic OSPF configuration patterns and verification.

items.title: OSPF verification
items.example:
show ip ospf neighbor
show ip route ospf

items.title: Common knobs
items.description: Use with care; mismatches can break adjacency.

rows: ip ospf hello-interval [s] / ip ospf dead-interval [s]

items.example: show ip ospf interface GigabitEthernet1/0/1 | include Hello|Dead|Cost

categories.title: BGP (Common)
categories.description: Session verification, advertised/received routes, and common operational checks.

items.title: BGP session checks
items.example:
show ip bgp summary
show ip bgp neighbors 192.0.2.2 | include BGP state|Last reset

items.title: Route-policy primitives (concepts)
items.description: Implementation differs: route-maps, prefix-lists, AS-path filters, communities.
items.example:
show ip prefix-list
show route-map

categories.title: First Hop Redundancy (HSRP/VRRP)
categories.description: Gateway redundancy for VLANs/SVIs.

items.title: HSRP verification
items.example: show standby brief

items.title: VRRP verification
items.example: show vrrp brief

categories.title: ACLs and Packet Filtering
categories.description: Standard/extended ACL concepts and operational checks.

items.title: ACL basics
items.description: Remember: ACLs are order-dependent; use explicit permits/denies and log carefully.
items.example: show access-lists

items.title: Verify ACL application
items.example:
show ip interface GigabitEthernet1/0/1 | include access list
show access-lists

categories.title: NAT and PBR (Concepts)
categories.description: NAT is common at edges; PBR overrides routing decisions. Syntax varies by platform.

items.title: NAT verification
items.example:
show ip nat translations
show ip nat statistics

items.title: PBR verification (route-map)
items.example:
show ip policy
show route-map

categories.title: QoS (High-level)
categories.description: QoS syntax differs widely (MQC, policy-maps). Use show commands to validate.

items.title: MQC building blocks
items.example:
show class-map
show policy-map

items.title: QoS verification
items.example: show policy-map interface GigabitEthernet1/0/1

categories.title: Management and Security
categories.description: SSH, AAA, SNMP, syslog, and operational hygiene.

items.title: SSH access (typical IOS-style)
items.description: Exact steps vary. Ensure domain name + crypto keys + vty transport.
items.example:
show ip ssh
show run | section line vty

items.title: AAA quick checks
items.description: AAA implementation depends on TACACS+/RADIUS design.
items.example: show run | include aaa|tacacs|radius

items.title: SNMP/syslog basics
items.description: Prefer SNMPv3 over v2c. Verify reachability to collectors.
items.example:
show logging
show ntp status

categories.title: Monitoring and Packet Capture
categories.description: NetFlow/IPFIX, SPAN, and on-box captures (platform-dependent).

items.title: NetFlow/IPFIX verification (common)
items.description: Exact commands differ by platform and configuration style (Flexible NetFlow, etc.).
items.example:
show flow exporter
show flow monitor
show run | include flow

items.title: SPAN / ERSPAN (common syntax)
items.description: Switch SPAN configuration is platform-specific; always validate session state and destination.
items.example: show monitor session all

items.title: Embedded Packet Capture (EPC) (IOS-XE; if supported)
items.description: On-box capture workflow. Command names vary by release.

rows: monitor capture point ip cef [name] [if] both

items.example: show monitor capture

categories.title: Troubleshooting Playbook (IOS / NX-OS)
categories.description: High-signal show commands and quick isolations: L1/L2/L3, routing, ARP, and path.

items.title: Layered triage
items.description: Start from link up -> L2 -> L3 -> policy -> app.

rows: show vlan brief; show mac address-table; show spanning-tree interface [if] detail
show ip interface brief; show arp; show ip route [dst]; ping; traceroute
show processes cpu sorted / show system resources

items.example:
show interfaces GigabitEthernet1/0/1
show spanning-tree interface GigabitEthernet1/0/1 detail
show ip route 8.8.8.8
ping 8.8.8.8
traceroute 8.8.8.8

items.title: CEF / forwarding checks (platform-dependent)
items.description: When routing looks correct but traffic still fails.

rows: show platform hardware qfp active statistics drop (IOS-XE; platform-dependent)

items.example: show ip cef 8.8.8.8

categories.title: NX-OS Notes (incl. vPC)
categories.description: Common NX-OS operational commands and vPC checks.

items.title: Feature model
items.description: NX-OS uses features that must be enabled.
items.example:
show feature
show interface brief
show port-channel summary

items.title: vPC verification
items.description: Always check vPC peer-link, peer-keepalive, and consistency.
items.example:
show vpc brief
show vpc consistency-parameters global

categories.title: ACI Concepts (Mental Model)
categories.description: How ACI objects map to connectivity: Tenant -> VRF -> BD -> EPG, plus Contracts and Policies.

items.title: Core objects
items.example: # ACI: think 'EPGs talk only if a contract permits it'.

categories.title: ACI Build: Tenant/VRF/BD/EPG (Checklist)
categories.description: High-level steps for a typical ACI application segment.

items.title: Typical build order
items.description: Exact navigation differs by APIC version, but the object flow is consistent.

rows: Add static paths or VMM binding
EPG not bound to a domain
No VLAN/VXLAN allocation; endpoints wonâ€™t come up
Gateway exists but routing policy differs

categories.title: ACI Contracts and Filters
categories.description: Allow traffic between EPGs with contracts (provider/consumer) and filters.

items.title: Contract components
items.example: # Remember: EPG A provides, EPG B consumes (directional).

items.title: Troubleshoot contracts
items.description: If endpoints are learned but traffic is blocked, contract/filter is a top suspect.

categories.title: ACI L3Out (External Connectivity)
categories.description: Route to/from external networks using L3Out and external EPGs.

rows: BGP/OSPF peer down or route control blocking
Contracts missing between internal EPG and External EPG

categories.title: APIC CLI Tools (moquery / icurl / acidiag)
categories.description: Operational tools on the APIC controller (commands vary by ACI/APIC version).

items.title: Common APIC tools
items.description: Use these to query managed objects (MOs), faults, endpoints, and controller health.
items.example:
moquery -c fvTenant
moquery -c faultInst | head
icurl -k https://127.0.0.1/api/node/class/fvTenant.json

items.title: Fault and endpoint queries (examples)
items.description: Class names are stable (faultInst, fvCEp), but attributes vary.
items.example:
moquery -c faultInst | head
moquery -c fvCEp | grep -i 'aa:bb:cc'

categories.title: APIC REST API (Basics)
categories.description: Call the APIC API for inventory, automation, and troubleshooting. Prefer secure handling of credentials/certs.

items.title: API query patterns
items.description: APIC provides class-based and DN-based endpoints and rich query parameters.
items.example:
# From a workstation (example only):
# 1) Login to get APIC-cookie
# 2) Query a class

curl -sk -c cookiejar.txt https://apic.example/api/aaaLogin.json \
  -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{"aaaUser":{"attributes":{"name":"admin","pwd":"PASSWORD"}}}'

curl -sk -b cookiejar.txt 'https://apic.example/api/node/class/fvTenant.json'

categories.title: ACI Troubleshooting
categories.description: Faults, endpoint learning, and common fabric checks.

items.title: Endpoint learning checks
items.description: Endpoints not learned is usually attachment/binding/path issue.
items.example:
moquery -c fvCEp | grep -i 'aa:bb:cc'
moquery -c faultInst | head

items.title: Fabric and leaf-level checks (conceptual)
items.description: On leaf/spine NX-OS-like CLI, verify interface, port-channel, and policy programming.
